website_summaries.verdict: Wacom's latest Intuos Pro pressure-sensitive pen tablets are better than ever, and if you like to start analog, the Paper edition adds neat capabilities.
pros: The 2017 version of the Wacom Intuos Pro delivers a fluid and responsive feel, decreased footprint  and more robust wireless connectivity, plus the Paper edition adds the ability to sketch while disconnected
cons: There still aren't any applications supporting its expanded pressure-sensitivity range and the Paper edition's Finetip Pen ink supply doesn't last very long

customer_reviews.title: Software problems since release, still not fixed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in January 2018. Ever since I've been having issues with modifier keys appearing to be stuck while using the pen (Mac OS). I have contacted Wacom multiple times, and uninstalled/installed the software per their instructions. This has been going on for 9 months now. They have confirmed it is a software issue so a new tablet would not fix the problem. There is still no fix 9 months later. They informed me there is no ETA for a fix either. So... that's it. I paid for a brick tablet and Wacom can't help. Do not buy this model or any Wacom model which uses these drivers.
customer_reviews.author: guillo

customer_reviews.title: Wacom drivers don't work with Sketch app. BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: There's a known bug since early 2017 that locks your shift key when you use this tablet. Stay away until they fix it. I have two of these and they are useless.
customer_reviews.author: Diego D. Zaks B

customer_reviews.title: Such a nice tablet!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a powerful tool. You can feel the effectiveness of the 8,000+ points of pressure sensitivity. It feels like drawing with an actual brush, pencil, etc. It's amazing. I love the amount of detail that you can get with digital painting/illustration. Here's my first go at it.
customer_reviews.author: MoBarbs

customer_reviews.title: Paper Edition is a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Like every thing about it except the paper nonsense added to it. It is a waste of money. Just get the medium without the paper crap. The image you get from this is such low res that it is not worth the time and effort. I'd be better off scanning my artwork than trying to work with this crap. Paper edition adds no value only frustration. In the picture above you can see what I've drawn on the bottom and the crap the paper edition gave me on top. I may not be the greatest artist, but that doesn't mean that I have to deal with BS from my electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Kellene Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: If this worked properly it would be awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I've given myself time to learn the software, but this tablet skips, stalls and freezes while using with Adobe Software like Photoshop. I was so excited to start using this Wacom tablet and saved up to buy it, but now it's just sitting next to my computer while I revert back to my mouse. I was thinking that it would work better with an Apple computer, I have a Dell. However, if all of my Adobe software functions with my Dell, why won't this function smoothly? If there is anyone out there with some suggestions, please leave a comment. Sighs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: What was supposed to be an upgrade from a Huion turned it to be the exact opposite. The first issue is that I have to connect and disconnect the tablet multiple times to get it to stop glitching out when initially plugging it into my computer. The best biggest issue is that more often than not, the dial responds erratically to even light tickets, brush size and zoom increasing and decreasing rapidly for up to 30 seconds after just a second-long touch. And last is the price. My Huion was $80 and worked much more reliably with equal specs. I will not be purchasing from Wacom again.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler D

customer_reviews.title: Great Pen Tablet for Graphic Designers and Photo Editing
customer_reviews.text: Recently upgraded my home studio to do more Freelance work, the Wacom tablet does exactly what I need. I use it full time in Illustrator and Photoshop and have since the Wacom tablets earliest incarnations. I honestly don't use most of the side buttons or touch and use it plugged in through USB rather than use the Bluetooth connection. Used for commercial graphic design and heavy photo editing. Definitely appreciate having the larger surface area for detail work on my large screen since its closer in scale to my 32" monitor than the smaller versions.
customer_reviews.author: Cela

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatible w/ Mac OS Mojave
customer_reviews.text: MAJOR FAIL. I've been troubleshooting for hours, downloading new drivers, old drivers, and this thing does NOT want to work on Mac OS Mojave. Technical support is NON-EXISTENT! This is literally a piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rice

customer_reviews.title: May or may not work with your machine?
customer_reviews.text: Currently facing issues with pressure sensitivity accuracy and working with them to figure the issue out. The build is exceptional as always from Wacom and the comfort of the pen is unmatched. They're awesome with customer service, surpassing many companies I've dealt with in the past. Random bursts of inaccurate pressure readings are keeping me from fully enjoying/using the device for employment and hobby. Costing me money by not working right at my job and giving me anxiety when it comes to trying to kill some time drawing because of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan H. Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had many tablets over the years and this is my latest. It comes with the usual Wacom driver software so is easy to set up. My biggest surprise is the surface. They include three sample pieces of a screen cover that can be purchased separately to control tactile feedback with the pen but I don't think any of them are necessary as the screen surface has plenty of tooth already. In fact I've never owned a tablet with this much surface grip for the pen tip. I generally tape a piece of paper over the screen to get that feedback but won't need to with this tablet. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ted M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hardware, Poor Instructions & Training
customer_reviews.text: From research, this is the most popular high-end or professional "pen tablet". And Wacom is the oldest and well-renowned brand. The hardware certainly seems well designed with excellent build quality. Installation instructions were somewhat confusing--the installation wizard got lost. The knowledge base on the web site is very weak. I encountered several broken links, and a serious lack of basic tutorial information. I'm going to be looking on YouTube to see if others have produced instructions that can help me start being productive with this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: John Busco

customer_reviews.title: Terrible experience
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with the bonus painting softwares. I asked the support before i bought them. I was under the impression that it had three painting bonus software. When i loaded it, it had a two month photo shop. I asked support about it and they said i had to buy the lesser model which was 100.00 cheaper. I dont get it. No solution. Terrible service amd experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Harrold

customer_reviews.title: Drawing surface is not as smooth as most tablets
customer_reviews.text: Lots of features for the price. Bluetooth is nice for , the radial wheel has programmable buttons, the gestures feature natural, intuitive. The ability to have different setups for different programs is great. This is appropriately named it is a pro-grade tablet. However, the drawing surface is not as smooth as most tablets and you can tell the difference as you had and the pen slides across it. If you have never used another table and can afford this it is the right one to start with. The surface is the only reason why I have it 4 stars as drawing is the most important function.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Hooke

customer_reviews.title: New & Not Working/Returned
customer_reviews.text: Downloaded drivers, restarted my computer, and NOTHING. Wacom tech support (once I found the phone number) just wanted to get me off the phone rather than help. Uninstalled and reinstalled drivers & NOTHING. Tried to get it to work on a different computer and NOTHING. I spent hours researching this product and trying to get it to work. Regret the entire experience. Will research other drawing tablets and hope to find something that will work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wacom doesn't maintain Driver Updates
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet for $400, unfortunately its completely unusable because Wacom doesn't sync its driver updates with the OS you are on. At times, you'll not want to update to the latest OS (I'm on Mac), but Wacom forces an update through that's incompatible. The last 9 months the pen has lagged so much I have to design on my trackpad. If you install a previous driver, you get random and frequent fatal errors that crash your computer. Good product, terrible customer service. Guess I'll save up for an iPad Pro and use that as a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: as long as I never turned the computer off it worked fine and beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable, made all the updates necessary to run and install the tablet, as long as I never turned the computer off it worked fine and beautifully...so every time I retart my Windows 10 laptop I get the message the driver is not running, I fix the problem, but once I turn the computer off the problem returns.... It messed my operating system after the last update....had to restore system.. what a headache! UPDATE After a few updates later, and few months after from both Wacom and Windows, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jordi

customer_reviews.title: Quality tablet but frustrating for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I like the tablet, however it is very frustrating that there is no manual included or to download to explain what all the buttons actually do. I am searching YouTube for How To instruction videos, which seem to be posted by individuals and not Wacom. A little book is much easier and has minimal cost to the company if it is online. Wacom has been doing tablets for a very long time. They are quality tablets, so why can’t they be more customer- friendly for us beginners?
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Girl

customer_reviews.title: I was like well that's lame
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I just got this tablet under an hour ago in the mail. I was changing my nib on it, and a piece of the pen tip chipped off?? What the actual F?? Seriously. I thought it was a piece of the nib, I was like well that's lame, but I got 6 more. BUT IT WAS A PIECE OF THE PEN? COOL
customer_reviews.author: Hizzy

customer_reviews.title: The industry standard for a reason
customer_reviews.text: You can never go wrong with wacom. This is the second wacom I've bought and used for nearly two years and it works just as perfectly well as when I bought it. The customization and sensitivity is unrivaled. Although a bit higher in price wacom continues to be the industry standard for digital illustration. The only thing you will have to replace regularly is the pen tip nibs and ink for the pen. I recommended this tablet to anyone who is serious about their digital art.
customer_reviews.author: Arik

customer_reviews.title: Overall I like it a lot, with some issues still to fix
customer_reviews.text: So as a photographer processing lots of photos each week, I made the decision to purchase this tablet to optimize my workflow. The result is a great quality product, that works wonderfully in Photoshop. There is a lag in lightroom (I'm on Mac) that drives me completely nuts with the brush. I've applied all solutions and recommendations from Wacom, and it still hasn't fixed the problem. I did not like the customer support side of things, because they're not only very slow, they plain stopped answering once we had reviewed the obvious reasons why there was a lag. I Thought about returning the tablet but decided to keep it, hoping for a fix at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: For the past few years I have been using a cheaper tablet for drawing, I decided it was time to upgrade and splurged on this. What a difference, sketching isn't that much different, but a little better... The big difference is in inking, where before I would have to go slow and be zoomed in to do a good job, with this I can be zoomed out and just go at a normal pace! Simply amazing, it easily cut the time I spend on a project in 1/2.
customer_reviews.author: JranZu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Product
customer_reviews.text: I love Wacom products. They last forever. I bought this because I was still using my Intuous 3 that’s I bought over 10 years ago! I lost the pen and thought it would be better to just upgrade than to buy a replacement pen for $80. I found the pen later, but that’s ok. I gave my Intuous 3 to my little sister so she can learn to draw digital art too. The Intuous pro is much lighter, it has Bluetooth connectivity, and everything about it is nice. I hope this one lasts me another 10 years, too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth stability is bad and edge swipe nonsense
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth stability is a disaster. The tablet will connect, and then if you don't use it for a couple days and charge it then you need to literally uninstall and reinstall the tablet to fix the bluetooth connection. I have to leave it plugged in to the USB cable. That is unfortunate. If you are left handed the edge swipe on Windows 10 will drive you insane. As your palm drags across the surface the Windows 10 task view keeps showing up. Finally figured out how to disable this in the Wacom properties, but it took two days to find and of course Wacom support was not helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Wacom tablet, I've been using them for years and have loved them. I bought this one a year ago and it's been very glitchy. I only use it wired, never via bluetooth. Sometimes it shuts itself off; start ups are slow; I have to use a mouse for updates because the pen freezes on the final update screen. I'm not happy that I have to keep a mouse handy for the occasional program freeze.
customer_reviews.author: Sound Investor

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Wacom tablets are spendy, but they are 100% worth the price tag. I had a smaller tablet by them for years but it didn't have much in the way of accessories and the surface was small. But this one is much bigger (granted i DID order the Medium) and not only is the tablet itself wonderful, it comes with all sorts of accessories. It has a pen holder with multiple ways to hold said pen, and inside of it are EXTRA NIBS. can't express how awesome that is. Each nib has a different style and feel, so experiment all you want! once again, Wacom delivers.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Benedict

customer_reviews.title: ... for just over 1 month and at first I loved it. Now it's not working
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for just over 1 month and at first I loved it. Now it's not working. It won't let me drag on the screen, the mouse disappears. And now it pulls up two "mice" whenever I try to use it so it just starts drawing rectangles all over my document. I've restarted it, I've restarted my computer, there's no new updates that I have not downloaded. Nothing is working to fix it. It's been one month and 14 days, so I'm out of the return window. And this soon on such an expensive product I should have more opportunities to have it fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Wells

customer_reviews.title: Worst Wacom purchase so far!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace my workhorse Intuos 2. I will most likely have to go back to it. The glitches I have experienced with this tablet are never-ending. Embarrassing as can be when you are in the middle of a demo, thanks a lot! I read a few reviews and thought it was a good choice, but in my 20+ years working as a retoucher in Photoshop, I have never had trouble like this with a tablet. Oh, and the nib wearing down within hours, not cool! Update, now it does not work at all, terrible, worst Wacom purchase ever!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Alcerro

customer_reviews.title: works fine if plugged in but BT connection is garbage
customer_reviews.text: It works just like any other Intuos, I use it in my home office for work. The BT connection is just straight garbage, 95% of the time it doesn't connect. I would have to remove the device and pair it again for it to maybe work. This is still an issue after multiple driver updates and firmware updates. If you need wireless tablet, don't get your hopes up.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Lin

customer_reviews.title: The Tablet comes without the creative software the regular Intuos come with.
customer_reviews.text: BUYERS BE AWARE! The Intuos Pro tablets come without the creative software the standard Intuos tablet come with. Buying the software separately, will cost you over $150.
customer_reviews.author: Or

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this model for all those doing any graphic design/illustration
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about the product and the delivery. My daughter loves this and uses it almost everyday. Well worth the money. Best birthday present she ever received. This particular product was recommended by my nephew who works for one of the top billboard/poster creation firm in LA doing movie and TV billboards and posters. It was the exact right choice. Just glad to have had someone in the know to provide guidance. He uses this model everyday as most of this co-workers do. And this size too.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Rough like sandpaper, Bluetooth is useless
customer_reviews.text: The texture of the working area is awful it’s like a sandpaper my pen nibs went in the first day And worst is the smooth texture from Wacom are very rare and expensive My solution was a protection film for Ipad pro 11” it covers the working area, not glass not rough it was fine. the Bluetooth is trouble laggy and I tried every tip google could find but yet no fix I am using windows 10 pro I don’t know About mac OS Don’t buy look for other alternatives I regret it really
customer_reviews.author: Emad Ghaly

customer_reviews.title: Typical Wacom Issues that'll never get fixed.
customer_reviews.text: It's like they intentionally make this thing difficult to use. My settings never stay saved very long. Even after restoring the saved settings, things like quick key orientation and many others are still reset. Half the time it doesn't work with Photoshop and Lightroom even using all the 'workarounds' posted by members of the community. I hate that this is really our only decent option at this price. Wacom, get better.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: Junk - Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolute garbage. The product I received from Amazon lasted only 6 months and I only used it twice. The battery is no longer able to fully charge and when I manage to get it 95% charged, it only lasts a couple of hours and this is with not even using the pad. Wacom is producing junk these days so stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: chaos

customer_reviews.title: Device was defective
customer_reviews.text: Tech support was very nice and did their best, but after constant removal / reinstall of drivers and having to reconfigure my tablet, support told me to return it. Issue I has was even though it was properly set for left-handed, all redirection where in the reverse. Up was down, down was up, left was right, and right was left. A temp fix was to reinstall the driver and reconfigure. It was madding.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a second computer. I have a 3 year old Wacom tablet that still works great. This newer model is sleeker, easy to install...had it up and running in minutes. The price was good, the construction is smooth and solid, the pen holder/nib storage is beautifully machined. Reaction time of pen from tablet to screen is fast, so drawing is much more intuitive. For the money, i like this tablet a lot
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Weak nibs and Bluetooth not working.
customer_reviews.text: I like the sleek design and that the drawing area goes all the way to the edge of the tablet. The hardware switch for touch is nice. What I don’t like is that the Bluetooth works sluggishly and that the nibs are weaker than previous gen product. I used it for about 4 weeks with 4 hours a day, and I have already wasted 2 nibs. Is this by design to protect the surface?
customer_reviews.author: C. Du

customer_reviews.title: SIZE LARGE/ no MEDIUM
customer_reviews.text: If you decide to buy this table I strongly recommend to buy the large size. I previously brought the medium size and unfortunately the tablet it's quite small, however I return it and exchange it for the large and I was quite satisfied with the size and drawing work space. One small note about the table is that the 4 corners that mark the working area doesn't not glow like the INTOUS 4, therefore don't be surpised. Over all the table it's great in both design and functionality. i strongly suggested it on top of the 4.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: I love this tablet but one thing I do want to ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet but one thing I do want to mention is of you have a small Mac (smaller than a classic one), the medium tablet might be too big for you. I had to switch to another computer since I don’t know where to lay my pen. (The size of tablet and screen doesn’t match easily for me, it takes a lot extra practice to get used to which I hope I can avoid) One other thing is the scratches leaving on the surface when I draw. I’m not using crazy forces, in fact I’m being really careful, but the stylus still leaves marks and it kind of scary...
customer_reviews.author: Arina Zhu

customer_reviews.title: The device just won't connect no matter what
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for almost exactly 14 months, and it's already breaking down on me :( for some reason it will not connect to any of my devices even when it is plugged in or 100% charged. the wacom properties always claims that there is no device connected. I've tried the latest drivers, resetting the tablet and using a new computer altogether but nothing seems to be working. it was basically useless on my windows 10 and the pen literally won't even show up on screen on either one of the macs...
customer_reviews.author: Avalon

customer_reviews.title: One of the best ones out there.
customer_reviews.text: Highly rated and one of the best tablets out there. The one I have has 8 programmable buttons and a circular "mouse", which are really helpful with PhotoShop. The desktop app is pretty straight forward. What I like the most how accurate it is in creating masks.
customer_reviews.author: Strodav

customer_reviews.title: Pressure Sensitiviy works inconsistently
customer_reviews.text: I would like some one to advise me of a better product. This one is very inconsistent. I am on the phone every other day Wacom technical support. because the pressure sensitivity does not work unless I remove the Wacom driver and replace it OR I HAVE TO REMOVE THE SETTINGS. This solution does not always work. I HAVE TO DO THIS ALMOST EVERY TIME I WANT TO USE IT. Stay away from Wacom they have an UNDESERVED REPUTATION.
customer_reviews.author: gary john johnson

customer_reviews.title: Longtime user of Wacom products. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Wacom Tablets for retouching, for almost 20 years. Bought this one after my Intuos 3 became obsolete. I was also excited for bluetooth functionality/freeing up a usb port. Nope... the lag is unacceptable. Next gripe: The "standard" surface eats up nibs like no tomorrow. Going to order a "smooth" sheet, and hopefully that helps. Seems kind of nickel and dime, for a fairly expensive product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Wacom my entire career. This product however, stopped working correctly a month after purchase. The calibration I have set never functions appropriately and I end up wasting hours each week reseting it. The pen fell apart (click control) and lags quite frequently. It is the cheaper model, I get it, but I expected a bit more quality for the price and the brand name. Super disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Keane

customer_reviews.title: Is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The buttons on the side can be pressed easily and are annoying even when disabled. I'm not sure if the scrolling center button can be disabled. I often accidentally rub up against these side buttons causing either the page to scroll, or stuff to pop up on the screen. I think that the surface should be smooth as possible for drawing but it's not with this product. Definitely buy a good hand sleeve with this wacom item.
customer_reviews.author: Mauraj

customer_reviews.title: hey this is good for your photoshop Zbrush and sketched book pro work
customer_reviews.text: hey this is good for your photoshop Zbrush and sketched book pro work. its expensive but I got a great deal. the paper aspect kind of sucks because you have to use their pen, i wish i could use any writing implement for it to work. it seems like something it should just do, but i think they want you to have to keep buying their stuff, so they want you to hook on the source. luck for me i only got that feature for my girl. she is into traditional art but im straight digital so i don't need it
customer_reviews.author: Gareth Mayers

customer_reviews.title: Supper disappointed in this
customer_reviews.text: I spent a week trying to get this tablet to work on my computer. Wacom keeps saying it was my computer. I even brought my system into my computer specialist, but he verified it wasn't my computer. I even tried it on my laptop - but same problem. The tablet will not communicate with my computer. The Wacom Driver doesn't not see the tablet. Wacom support keeps going back to my system as the problem versus their driver. Supper disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.author: Reader101

customer_reviews.title: Tech Support below par
customer_reviews.text: The special feature of this *expensive* tablet is that it can be used when not attached to a computer. Brilliant concept! A special application is required to copy saved work from the tablet to the computer, but on my computer the application fails to install. Now the reason for 2 stars: After I opened a ticket Wacom Customer Support did not respond for an entire week. When I escalated with a phone call Wacom Customer Support requested a screenshot. Now 7 work hours later Wacom Customer Support has not even acknowledged receipt of the screenshot.
customer_reviews.author: Una

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tablet!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet so much. Just started 3D modeling for tabletop gaming and I am amazed how effortless this tablet makes it. I do have one complaint however. The stylus nibs wear out really fast. I’ve used other tablets and never seen any wear on nibs before. I got this thing 4 days ago and have about 6 hours of sculpting on it and already have a nib work down to a 45 degree angle. Other than that, I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Stalhood

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible
customer_reviews.text: It will be returned tomorrow. I literally hate the Wacom Pro. I thought it would be my lifesaver! However it sucks. I am returning mine asap. Totally not user friendly at all, not even usable. I don't have 6 months to play with it, get settings adjusted for the pen or the crazy white marks for which you can find any instructions. I have spent a week trying. It is obnoxious.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it's worth it to save for this one
customer_reviews.text: I have used wacom for many years and thought they were all mostly the same tablet. The first 5 minutes of this, I immediately noticed a difference. The drivers are amazing, the feel is amazing, and it all feels so solid. I highly recommend saving for the medium rather than getting an "in between er" if you are serious about your digital art.
customer_reviews.author: EVY

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last 3 months!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May, worked fine and nicely. Then after 1 month I started having problems. When I would try to draw, the pen would continue to mark even though I have not touched the pad with my pen. The pen pressure would stop working as well. I updated my drivers, reinstalled, and even got a new computer because I thought my old computer was the problem! My old cheap bamboo tablet lasted me over 10 years. This hasn't even lasted 3 months! This is frustrating and a let down because Wacom is usually a decent company for drawing tablets...Trying to find a way to fix or get a new one. Very disappointed at this product...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still taking some getting used to since I became more comfortable with traditional art rather than digital
customer_reviews.text: Such an upgrade from my Wacom pen and touch tablet I bought for 30 dollars in 2010!! Still taking some getting used to since I became more comfortable with traditional art rather than digital. It takes some practice to not be looking at your hand while drawing. I recommend getting a Nibsaver/ tablet cover since i wore through half a nib in a week of use vs. not making a dent in a nib I've been using for months with a protector. Love the hotkeys and wheel it makes my work go quicker. Love this so far but probably will look for a drawing device with a screen next!!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey B

customer_reviews.title: Great size for precision drawing.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tablet, the pen tip compared to the older seams to consume faster, but i think is because the older tablets had a shiny smoother surface. This one feels more abrasive, but the great thing you can change the surface layer if it gets damaged or need different smooth type layer surface with a choice of 3 type. Other then the more sensitive response of the new pen, I don’t see a great deal of difference from previous models ( i had 2016 small ). Price is pretty correct. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: F. Zeri

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: This is what my art major uses in her classes. Without knowing what next school year will hold, I wanted to be sure that she could still work on her art at home. The shipping was lightning fast and packaged securely.
customer_reviews.author: D Willis

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: A creative pad that does more than draw, it acts as a full on creative station. Pad can be used as a mouse to control your computer with either hand or pen, and customizable quick wheel and keys make creating fast and convenient. Wouldn’t necessarily recommend for beginners due to all of the detailed controlling, but a beginner would definitely be able to easily learn this device in due time.
customer_reviews.author: Doran Starks

customer_reviews.title: The Wacom pen is not working suddenly.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not even been 2 months that I received this Wacom and The pen stopped working suddenly. I’ve been using this product for last 2 years at my workplace, never had such an issue . Please let me know how to return it as I’m having a doubt about it’s quality.
customer_reviews.author: kartikeya gupta

customer_reviews.title: have been using it for many years and absolutely liked it. This one (newest) has some issues
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's ok. I own older version, have been using it for many years and absolutely liked it. This one (newest) has some issues. It doesn't come with a mouse (the older one did). There are issues with the driver: it causes malfunction of Adobe software - some shortcuts and key combinations do not work. You'll need to manually uninstall the driver and download the earlier version from Wacom website.
customer_reviews.author: iZay

customer_reviews.title: Don't Purchase - 72 DPI Resolution ONLY
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed that there was no mention about the art created with this tablet will only capture at 72 DPI resolution. This is a function of the tablet's use of software called Inkspace app. The tablet works well but the software stinks regarding resolution. It totally defeats the use of this product with professional use other than online 72-dpi uses. The marketing of this product is deceptive and should be corrected. I saw no information that explained the Inkspace resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Swann

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This product scratches very easily. I hadn’t even been using it for a few hours before I noticed I was scuffing the surface with the pen. I bought a cover for it and the issues continued. I’m guessing the touch screen registers that the surface is constantly being touched by the adhesive cover so it will sometimes zoom in and not stop, or draw really thick lines. I’ve messed with the settings to try and fix it, but to no avail. I’d been saving up for years to buy this product and it is not worth the very hefty price. If I could go back, I would buy something much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: JoseG

customer_reviews.title: Buy it will love it
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever Drawing Tablet and after careful reading many reviews here in Amazon, Youtube, and friends i have decided to go for it ... I really was so happy to buy and try this Wacom Intous Pro... as soon as i unboxed this Tablet i stated using it (of course it hard at the beginning ) on Photo Editing using Photoshop. This Wacom made my editing of my wildlife Photo a lot easy and accurate. Thank you Wacom for such a great tool
customer_reviews.author: ALJUFAIN

customer_reviews.title: Not much of a difference from the previous intuos tablet
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I went from the old intuos to the new one was because it broke. If you’re thinking of upgrading from the old intuos to the new one, I don’t really think there’s much of a noticeable difference besides yhe much, much better design. Personally think it would have been perfect if it wasn’t so laggy when using bluetooth. Makes bluetooth esentially pointless tbh.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: switching between pen and touch issues.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Though its a bit annoying when you want to switch from Pen to Touch. Always there is a lag in detecting the fingers when switching between the Pen and Touch. Not sure if this is considered defective product or just the product limitation. I tried reinstalling the drivers and I updated my firmware to the latest but no luck, same issue. I'm using it on Windows. I will try it on Macbook later and update the review. Hopefully this is just software glitch which will fixed later.
customer_reviews.author: Ammar

customer_reviews.title: A Nightmare To Install Software/Drivers!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE worse device I have ever installed in my computer. The software and driver installation process is sooooooooooooo unclear and confusing it is RIDICULOUS. I do not recommend this product for people that have no computer skills.
customer_reviews.author: Mister M

customer_reviews.title: Nice when it works
customer_reviews.text: After nearly two years of owning this tablet I can easily report that it has worked well only some of the time. Wacom support is lacking and repetitive, most often resorting to scripts and telling you to do the same thing over and over without ever trying to understand the real underlying issues with the products. If I could go back and do this over, I would never, ever buy another Wacom product again.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Crappy wear and tear limits.
customer_reviews.text: Wacom has seen better days with their tablets. My old intuos 3 had been with me for 10 years until I just upgraded to this a few months ago. With this new one the textured surface has already worn off and the pen nibs wear down so quickly as if I'm running them across sandpaper...3 months of constantly using this for work and the wear on it looks like it's 10 years old... The amount of money Wacom charges for these is not worth the quality you get. On the other hand their cintiqs are great so I might just ditch this thing and pick one of those up.
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: Wireless is suspect.
customer_reviews.text: Works well sometimes when wired. Wireless through bluetooth is incredibly unreliable on Windows 10. Additionally, randomly starts acting strange while using whether wired or not. Stops registering pen touching tablet and starts placing brush strokes when still not touching the tablet. Need to reboot computer when this happens, which is all the time. Pathetic quality control, which is par for the course from tech companies, whether they shill hardware or software.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Check for broken bits when it arrives (happened on both sent by Amazon so it might be a design flaw)
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work with every illustration application since you can't override native app functions (will update after using with Corel Draw). Check for broken bits as soon as you unpack (happened on both devices sent by Amazon so it might be a design flaw).
customer_reviews.author: To Be Continued...

customer_reviews.title: I’ve had multiple and keep coming back!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet. Had another of the same model for a year or two and just replaced it because I spilled coffee all over it. Love the wireless function and programmable keys. Gestures for zooming in and out are good too, as well as the option to turn off gestures.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Brown

customer_reviews.title: New world fo creativity
customer_reviews.text: I like the tutorials available on the Wacom web site including set up instructions.. Can't wait to watch more videos on using it. the medium size is a perfect balance between fitting on my desk along with keyboard and adequate area for working.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Talley

customer_reviews.title: Love at first sight, but is slightly huge
customer_reviews.text: I'm too loyal to Wacom, so I can't really say much about the functionality and the features. I love everything and it's really great with the paper option. I'm a traditional artist and will always love this feature. It's easy to set up, basically does it for you. Has some useful accessories and replacement pen nibs which wasn't provided in my bamboo so I was especially excited. The only one thing that confused me was how huge it was. I've always thought that an A5 is perfect but never expected an A4 to be huge. I mean the working space is excellent but the tablet itself extends beyond an A3. Still is great when taken around.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah aldalama

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: For new users to tablets. The mapping of the functions for each individual piece of software might seem a bit daunting, but overall. This is literally what every graphic artist and photographer needs in their arsenal for design and post-production. The ease of functions and quality of build. This is by far one of the best investments I have made towards my business outside of buying another monolight or lens. Perfect for downtime during quarantine as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Howard Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but problems...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th or 5th Wacom tablet and it's hands down the worst one I've owned. I've had it only a few months and it's given me nothing but problems, including a weird delay issue, and, most recently, suddenly and randomly not registering pen pressure. I've been on the phone with their support people multiple times and tried all their fixes, even resetting all of my Photoshop preferences, but nothing works. Highly, highly disappointed and frustrated with this purchase. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Zucca

customer_reviews.title: I am returning the tablet too bad it would'nt work it's an elegant design
customer_reviews.text: The Tablet would not pair with my bluetooth even though I tried it with two different bluetooth recievers. I called Wacom tech support twice and got contradictory advice from two different people. I spent about five hours trying different solutions but nothing would work. If Wacom had designed the device with straight up wireless perhaps there would less of a problem. I am returning the tablet too bad it would'nt work it's an elegant design.
customer_reviews.author: David Soderberg

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. After install and updating the tablet and my programs works smooth. Love the 10 tips 6 normal ones and the 4 others are fun to mess with. Bluetooth works great as well connects and there is a little lag nothing like really bad when on Bluetooth but that is normal for my pc with the Bluetooth. I will from here out always buy Wacom
customer_reviews.author: Amy Lynn Richards

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The cursor jumps all over the place and I've tried everything I can to try to fix it. I've also just tried to use it like that and within a couple clicks the menu screen pops up. It's utterly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kat M

customer_reviews.title: As expected from a Wacom tablet
customer_reviews.text: As expected from a Wacom tablet, ease of use and crazry build quality. This is my first upgrade since 2005 when I got my graphire 4 (shows how well made Wacom tablets are) so it was a huge improvement in all aspects for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos V

Unfortunately when it was delivered the clip (like the clip on a clipboard) was broken rendering the "paper edition" part of the deal unusable. I sent Wacom customer service a note, via their web portal, to let them know about the problem and request a replacement clip but they have been unresponsive. Their unresponsiveness leaves me wondering if their intention is just ignore me. (The one-star indication is based only on the information above).
customer_reviews.author: Jim Fridley

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: If you use Lightroom or photoshop very much, this product is a must have. It completely changes how you work with two programs. Simply put, could not do what we do without it. Very easy to use and very intuitive. It was recommended to us by professional photographers and they were spot on with this recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Karger

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but large is too big for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I loved it. Problem being that it is too big for what I would use it for. A medium would be far more convenient for the photo retouching I do. If you are using it for sketching/drawing, the large is perfect. But for retouching, it is was to much surface area
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Why did I not buy this sooner
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and no experience necessary to learn the system.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Hicks

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect, everything I could ever wish for in a ...

This thing has touch controls, smart keys, it's wireless when charged, you can turn the touch on/off, you can use the pen, it's great! I don't have any issues with it, it's the perfect size. It's a little smaller than my keyboard, length wise, but PERFECT.
customer_reviews.author: mandie bunger

customer_reviews.title: Graphic designer no brainer tool
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using Wacom tablets now for 18 years. Being in advertising, this is a much needed tool in the industry. Over the years they have gotten thinner and thinner. No issues with install, as always. Fast delivery. Thumbs up for this product.
customer_reviews.author: TPAGE

customer_reviews.title: Glitching less than a year, and can't return.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this less then a year, and I've only used it 10 times and my settings on the express keys keep changing and very frustrating. So expensive and glitchy not worth the money. Also I can't even return it, so disappointed. Save your money for the Wacom Cintiq 16.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this if you use a Mac.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this if you use a Mac. They have a driver issue that is not compatible with the latest MacOS. They said they are working on it but it's been over a year and I still have the same problem. Every once and a while the pen will start acting like the Shift or Command key is being pressed. Today it happened three times and the only thing to do is to re-start the whole computer. Not happy at all... this is a know issue for Wacom and this tablet. This issue happens on both desktop and laptop for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: BUGGY GARBAGE

This is the worst product I've ever received from Wacom and I swear off the company from here on out. AVOID THIS PRODUCT IF YOU WANT A TABLET LONGER THAN A FEW MONTHS.

customer_reviews.author: Andrew Butler

customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for me! I have animation/design knowledge but dont feel confident enough to buy a professional cintiq. This is perfect for beginners at well. It's easy to use. Though the set up takes a long time to do.

customer_reviews.title: Wacom for life
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using Wacom Tablets for roughly 10 years now. Started with the old Wacon Intuos Pro Large and I’m currently using the Cintiq 24HD. This new Wacom Intuos range is much better than the old versions. Although its no Cintiq, you get great value for money and its easy to transport due to is compact size. And as a bonus, it also includes ghe new pen, which is already 50-80 dollars on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Komedie

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Tablet, Incredible Pen!
customer_reviews.text: Normally I don't write reviews, but I have to gush over this! (also included a quick sketch made with the tablet) Installing drivers were no problem, the tablet is perfect (I did get the Smooth Texture surface in addition though, which I would highly recommend), and the pen! The pen has improved sensitivity and is very responsive. I'm an artist/animator who's struggled on and off with pain problems, and Wacom has always been the easiest on my hand. This tablet is everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: megan milligan

customer_reviews.title: A bit sensitive
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Wacom for years, needed to upgrade and did just that recently - gets 4 stars only because it's a bit too sensitive (Maybe in time I will be able to master it) but until then am stuck with the feature which makes it hard to get fluid lines without the directional skipping on you.
customer_reviews.author: Jezli Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: so I am happy to be able to get a head start on ...
customer_reviews.text: It arrived a day earlier than I expected, so I am happy to be able to get a head start on setting things up. customer_reviews.title: Greatest TAB
customer_reviews.text: Wacom is a must for designers, All adobe apps, and 3d modeling apps come alive. Compatibility is a must and this tablet works with all.

customer_reviews.text: Just got the tablet. The first thing it says is that the pen needs a firmware update. I click ok and the update FAILS... so now my pen and tablet don't work at all. I've been on hold with wacom support for over an hour. How can something this basic happen?

customer_reviews.title: I ♡ my wacom
customer_reviews.text: Big improvement over my last. Love the bruse size and side shortcuts!!!
customer_reviews.author: Awesome McNeato

product_meta.title: Wacom Intuos Pro Paper Edition Digital Graphic Drawing Tablet for Mac or PC, Medium (PTH660P), New Model
product_meta.description: Size:Medium| Style:Paper EditionThe professional standard in creative pen tablets Wacom Intuits Pro sets a new standard for professional pen tablets. The new Wacom Pro Pen 2 features impressive pressure sensitivity, tilt response and virtually lag free tracking. Get natural creative control while you illustrate, edit or design digitally with Intuits Pro. Paper to digital workflow Some artists and designers work only digitally, while others start on paper. The new Intuits Pro line lets you do both. For all digital work, choose the standard Intuits Pro. To sketch on paper and refine digitally, select the revolutionary Intuits Pro Paper Edition. The Paper Edition combines the Intuits Pro tablet with a detachable Paper Clip and Fine tip Pen. Clip your drawing paper on the tablet and sketch. While you sketch on paper, an editable version is captured and stored on the tablet. You don't need to be online or connected to a computer when you are sketching, so work anywhere, anytime. If you need to immediately share your sketches with others, Wacom Intuits Pro Paper Edition connects to your iOS or Android device over Bluetooth LE. The version of Wacom Ink space app (available from February 2017 on) will let you view, export and share right away. Connect Intuits Pro Paper Edition to your computer whenever you choose. Ink space syncs, stores and exports your sketches in creative file formats. Then fine tune your work with the Intuits Pro tablet, Wacom Pro Pen 2 and your favorite creative software on Mac or PC. Individualize your digital workplace Customizable Express Keys, Touch Ring, Radial Menus and pen side switches provide easy shortcuts. Multi touch surface lets you zoom, pan and navigate. Three different Texture Sheets (from smooth to rough) personalize your tablet surface feel. Sold separately Slim and Compact Intuits Pro is super slim and compact. The included Wacom Pro Pen 2 has interchangeable pen tips. A beautiful new pen stand and a protective accessory soft case for your paper clip, pens and nibs are included. Connect to your PC or Mac with built in Wireless Bluetooth or a USB cable. Offered with paper edition models even more creative options the standard intuits pro and the paper edition are available in medium and large sizes. Accessories (sold separately): Ballpoint Pen, Fine tip Pen, Pencil (available mid 2017), Texture Sheets, Soft Cases, Pen Nibs, and Refills.
feature_bullets: Paper-to-digital ability lets you capture editable versions of your pen-on-paper sketches completely digital from start to finish and export as raster or vector files.8192 levels of pressure sensitivity, tilt-response and virtually lag-free tracking with new Pro Pen 2 technology

System requirements: USB port, Windows 7 or later (64bit), Mac OS 10.10 or later, Bluetooth Classic for wireless connection to PC or Mac, Bluetooth LE for wireless connection to mobile devices (in paper mode), Internet connection to download driver and Software.
The Paper Edition consists of the new Intuos Pro tablet & Pro Pen 2 combined with a detachable Paper Clip and a Fine tip (gel) Pen for sketching on paper
Connect tablet to your Mac or PC without paper, using the Pro Pen 2 and it works as a regular Wacom Intuos Pro
Super-slim tablet design with a more compact footprint (13.2” x 8.5”) and larger active area than previous models (8.7” x 5.8”).
